title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard incorrectly handles nested classes context
description: When using the new class wizard, the context for nested classes is not properly handled, leading to an issue where the 'Enclosing Type' field remains blank instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
OB: When clicking the new class button with a .java file open in the editor and checking 'Enclosing Type', the field remains blank.
EB: In Build 20011106, when a .java file is open in the editor and the new class wizard is triggered, the 'Enclosing Type' field should automatically default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the 'New Class' button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field.
